name: Figure-4 Glute Stretch
setup: Lie on back with knees bent, feet flat on floor
Cross right ankle over left thigh, just above knee
steps: Reach hands through legs and clasp behind left thigh
Gently pull left thigh toward chest
Keep right foot flexed to protect knee
Feel stretch in right glute and outer hip
Hold for prescribed time, breathing deeply
cues: Keep head and shoulders relaxed on floor
Pull knee toward chest, not toward shoulder
mistakes: Lifting head and shoulders off floor
Pulling knee toward shoulder instead of chest
Forcing the stretch too deep too quickly
safety: Stop if you feel knee pain. Flex top foot to protect knee joint. Avoid if you have hip impingement or recent hip injury.

regressions: Keep bottom foot on floor (don't pull knee toward chest)
Use towel around thigh if you can't reach

prescriptionHints.notes: Essential for hip and glute mobility. Particularly helpful after squats or deadlifts.

joints.notes: Keep top foot flexed throughout to protect knee. Relax into stretch; don't force it.
